pull.title: build: Rename `PACKAGE_*` variables to `CLIENT_*`
pull.body:
The use of `PACKAGE_NAME` for the project's variable name is problematic, as this name is commonly used in CMake's [interface variables](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/command/find_package.html#config-mode-version-selection). If third-party CMake code handles with scopes improperly, our `PACKAGE_NAME` variable could end up with an unexpected value.

This PR avoids such conflicts by renaming all `PACKAGE_*` variables to `CLIENT_*`.

The code in the master branch works correctly only incidentally. It is definitely broken in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30997.

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#bitcoin-core/gui/762](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/762) (Update about logo icon (colour) to denote the chain type of the QT instance in About/ Help Message Window/ Dialog by pablomartin4btc)
* [#31130](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31130) (Drop miniupnp dependency by darosior)
* [#31072](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31072) (refactor: Clean up messy strformat and bilingual_str usages by ryanofsky)
* [#30988](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30988) (Split CConnman by vasild)
* [#30928](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30928) (tinyformat: refactor: increase compile-time checks and don't throw for tfm::format_error by stickies-v)
* [#30909](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30909) (wallet, assumeutxo: Don't Assume m_chain_tx_count, Improve wallet RPC errors by fjahr)
* [#29686](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29686) (Update manpage descriptions by willcl-ark)
* [#29641](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29641) (scripted-diff: Use LogInfo over LogPrintf [WIP, NOMERGE, DRAFT] by maflcko)
* [#28710](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28710) (Remove the legacy wallet and BDB dependency by achow101)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Rebased due to the conflict with the merged https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26334.

Shouldn't #30997 be based on this PR then (or at least mention in the PR description it's expected to be broken)?

scripted-diff: Clarify "user agent" variable name

This change allows to the use of the `CLIENT_` namespace without
potential name clashes.

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
sed -i "s/\<CLIENT_NAME\>/UA_NAME/g" $( git grep -l "CLIENT_NAME" ./src)
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

build: Rename `PACKAGE_*` variables to `CLIENT_*`

The use of `PACKAGE_NAME` for the project's variable name is
problematic, as this name is commonly used in CMake's interface
variables. If third-party CMake code handles with scopes improperly,
our `PACKAGE_NAME` variable could end up with an unexpected value.

This change avoids such conflicts by renaming all `PACKAGE_*` variables
to `CLIENT_*`.

events.message:
build: Rename `PACKAGE_*` variables to `CLIENT_*`

The use of `PACKAGE_NAME` for the project's variable name is
problematic, as this name is commonly used in CMake's interface
variables. If third-party CMake code handles with scopes improperly,
our `PACKAGE_NAME` variable could end up with an unexpected value.

This change avoids such conflicts by renaming all `PACKAGE_*` variables
to `CLIENT_*`.

verification.payload:
tree 2f65888268da93f12b143e0c39b52e71fdfd905c
parent 177ca04dc96515a594a01a3d6d63dd282661c32c
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1728643870 +0100
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1729784381 +0100

scripted-diff: Rename `PACKAGE_*` variables to `CLIENT_*` in sources

This change ensures consistent use of the `CLIENT_` namespace across
both the build and source contexts.

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-

ren() { sed -i "s/\<$1\>/$2/g" $( git grep -l "$1" ./src ./cmake/bitcoin-build-config.h.in :\(exclude\)./src/secp256k1 ) ; }

ren PACKAGE_NAME      CLIENT_NAME
ren PACKAGE_VERSION   CLIENT_VERSION_STRING
ren PACKAGE_URL       CLIENT_URL
ren PACKAGE_BUGREPORT CLIENT_BUGREPORT

-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

events.message:
scripted-diff: Rename `PACKAGE_*` variables to `CLIENT_*` in sources

This change ensures consistent use of the `CLIENT_` namespace across
both the build and source contexts.

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-

ren() { sed -i "s/\<$1\>/$2/g" $( git grep -l "$1" ./src ./cmake/bitcoin-build-config.h.in :\(exclude\)./src/secp256k1 ) ; }

ren PACKAGE_NAME      CLIENT_NAME
ren PACKAGE_VERSION   CLIENT_VERSION_STRING
ren PACKAGE_URL       CLIENT_URL
ren PACKAGE_BUGREPORT CLIENT_BUGREPORT

-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

scripted-diff: Rename `PACKAGE_*` variables to `CLIENT_*` in tests

This change ensures consistent use of the `CLIENT_` namespace everywhere
in the repository.

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-

ren() { sed -i "s/\<$1\>/$2/g" $( git grep -l "$1" ./test/functional ./test/config.ini.in ) ; }

ren PACKAGE_NAME      CLIENT_NAME
ren PACKAGE_BUGREPORT CLIENT_BUGREPORT

-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

events.message:

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -47,14 +47,14 @@ project(BitcoinCore
   LANGUAGES NONE
 )
 
-set(PACKAGE_VERSION ${PROJECT_VERSION})
+set(BITCOIN_PACKAGE_VERSION ${PROJECT_VERSION})
 if(CLIENT_VERSION_RC GREATER 0)
-  string(APPEND PACKAGE_VERSION "rc${CLIENT_VERSION_RC}")
+  string(APPEND BITCOIN_PACKAGE_VERSION "rc${CLIENT_VERSION_RC}")
comments.body: nit: When renaming this, wouldn't it make more sense to use the `CLIENT_VERSION_` prefix here as well? (Maybe the two other variables others could use the `CLIENT_` prefix as well?)

 if(CLIENT_VERSION_RC GREATER 0)
-  string(APPEND PACKAGE_VERSION "rc${CLIENT_VERSION_RC}")
+  string(APPEND BITCOIN_PACKAGE_VERSION "rc${CLIENT_VERSION_RC}")
comments.body: I think if we end up doingthat, we should extend this to renaming other source variables that exist in the PACKAGE_ namespace. This PR as-is is already changing things such that naming becomes more inconsistent in that regard.

   set(abs_top_srcdir ${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR})
   set(abs_top_builddir ${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR})
-  set(PACKAGE_URL ${PROJECT_HOMEPAGE_URL})
-  set(PACKAGE_TARNAME "bitcoin")
+  set(CLIENT_URL ${PROJECT_HOMEPAGE_URL})

comments.body: In b75d532ca4703e26f59c7d33a882a6c1295784ed: The `CLIENT_TARNAME` re-naming is incomplete.
